main event: A yellowish light arranged in a triangular formation moved at a low elevation above the trees in Organ Pass, New Mexico, on September 15, 1960.
interesting points: The object had an angular velocity of approximately 3000 mph., The observation lasted for 3 minutes., The initial analysis suggested the object was likely aircraft., The report involved a professional astronomer as the witness., Another observation involved a satellite moving at estimated speeds of 12,000 to 15,000 knots.
sighted object: a yellowish light in a triangular formation
witness description: a professional astronomer with extensive experience in optical research
